column4: That might help a big - well it might mean you can fix it with a bit of a hack.
or that does not matter?
Do you have it set up with Ubuntu/SuSE dual boot?
no, when i trry to install suse on mine it just does the same thing... black screen then says no signal
it does load the kernel though... but then it goes to the black screen
Oh, right, so it isn't installed yet?  Is there an option in the boot message (before "Loading kernel") to do a text install?
no, theres like boot from harddrive (loads ubuntu) and there is like install suse and some other options im posative no text install though
Silly question, maybe, but do you choose 'install' or 'boot from harddrive'?
install
we havent tried the ctrl +alt + f1 yet...
whats it do?
It should give you a text console - ie, without a graphical interface.
Am I inteligent enough to do that? lol
... but that was when I though you had it installed already.
oh
For SuSE you would do better joining the #suse channel.  I can help a bit but most people here will only be able to help with Ubuntu.

yeah I havent even got it installed yet... I wait for my asus motherboard screen to come up the tap f8 to load from memorex cd and load the disk at my boot... then it takes me to the linux screen and I hit install and it says loading kernel and goes to black screen and says no signal
The "No signal" is a message from the the monitor to tell you that it is not getting anything from the computer.  Basically, it means that the graphics card is not configured properly.
oh hmmm...
but it is installed properly... I installed all the drivers
Ubuntu is generally better at automatic hardware configuration than other distributions.
hey
